title: 113_s2279
content: The Energy Freedom and Economic Prosperity Act of 2014 repeals tax subsidies for alcohol fuel, biodiesel, and alternative fuel mixtures under Title I. Section 6426 is repealed, with various conforming amendments made to related sections such as 4101, 4104, 6427, 7704, and 9503. The table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65 is amended by removing the item related to section 6426. The amendments made by this section apply to fuel sold and used after the enactment of this Act, except for liquefied hydrogen which applies after September 30, 2014. SEC. 102. EARLY TERMINATION OF CREDIT FOR QUALIFIED FUEL CELL MOTOR VEHICLES. Section 30B, a tax credit, is repealed with various conforming amendments to related sections. The effective date for these changes is for property placed in service after December 31, 2014. The tax credit for qualified plug-in electric drive motor vehicles under Section 30D is repealed, effective for vehicles placed in service after the enactment of this Act. Additionally, the credit for alcohol used as fuel is also repealed. SEC. 104 repeals the credit for alcohol used as fuel, with corresponding amendments to other sections. The effective date for these changes is after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 105 repeals the enhanced oil recovery credit. Section 43 is repealed, with conforming amendments to other sections. The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2014. SEC. 106 repeals the credit for producing oil and gas from marginal wells, effective for production after December 31, 2014. SEC. 107 terminates the credit for production from advanced nuclear power facilities, effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2014. SEC. 108 repeals the credit for carbon dioxide sequestration. SEC. 108 repeals the credit for carbon dioxide sequestration, effective for carbon dioxide captured after December 31, 2014. SEC. 109 terminates the energy credit for property placed in service after December 31, 2014. SEC. 110 repeals the qualifying advanced coal project. SEC. 110 repeals the qualifying advanced coal project under Section 48A, with amendments to Section 46 and effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2014. SEC. 111 repeals the qualifying gasification project credit under Section 48B, with amendments to Section 46 and effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2014. SEC. 112 repeals the qualifying advanced energy project credit under Section 48C, with amendments to Section 46 and effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2014. Corporate income tax rate is reduced under SEC. 121. The Secretary of the Treasury will prescribe new tax rates to offset revenue changes from amendments made by the Act, ensuring a uniform reduction in rates. Effective date for the new rates will be determined by the Secretary. The Secretary will set new tax rates to offset revenue changes from the Act, effective for taxable years starting more than 1 year after the Act's enactment.
